moves.2. d4 Bb7 3. Bd3 e6: Not Nc3, because then the c-pawn can't support d4.
moves.4. Nf3 Nf6 5. Nbd2 d5 6. e5 Nfd7 7. O-O: ?! dubious move, hoping for Nxh4 ... Qxh4
moves.12. Qc2 h6 13. Nh5 Rc8: Threatening ... cxd4, followed by ... Nxd4 with a discovered attack on the Queen
moves.23. Qxg5+ Kf7 24. Qf6+: I should have played Qg7+, followed by Nf6#.
moves.24... Ke8 25. Bxf8 Rf7: Black resigned, but in this position, White can play 26. Rxe6+ Kxf8 27. Qh8#
